description: [Status: stable] [Name: redirected-noqa] [Message: {original} is a redirect to {target}] What it does Checks for noqa directives that use redirected rule codes. Why is this bad? When one of Ruff's rule codes has been redirected, the implication is that the rule has been deprecated in favor of another rule or code. To keep your codebase consistent and up-to-date, prefer the canonical rule code over the deprecated code. Example x = eval(command) # noqa: PGH001 Use instead: x = eval(command) # noqa: S307
